cogs.loops package#

Submodules#

cogs.loops.assets module#

class cogs.loops.assets.Assets(bot, db=None)[source]#

Bases: Cog

The class is responsible for posting the assets of Discord users. You can enabled / disable it in config under [“LOOPS”][“ASSETS”].

async assets(portfolio_db)[source]#

Only do this function at startup and if a new portfolio has been added. Checks the account balances of accounts saved in portfolio db, then updates the assets db.

Parameters:

portfolio_db (pd.DataFrame) – The portfolio db or the db for a new user.

Return type:

None

async format_exchange(exchange_df, exchange, e)[source]#

Formats the embed used for updating user’s assets.

Parameters:

  • exchange_df (pd.DataFrame) – The dataframe of assets owned by a user.

  • exchange (str) – The exchange the assets are on, currently only ‘binance’ and ‘kucoin’ are supported.

  • e (discord.Embed) – The embed to be formatted.

  • old_worth (str) – The worth of the user’s assets before the update.

  • old_assets (str) – The assets of the user before the update.

Returns:

The new embed.

Return type:

discord.Embed

async get_user(assets)[source]#
async get_user_channel(name)[source]#

Based on the username returns the user specific channel.

Parameters:

name (str) – The name of the Discord user.

Returns:

The user specific channel.

Return type:

discord.TextChannel

post_assets#

A background task helper that abstracts the loop and reconnection logic for you.

The main interface to create this is through loop().

async usd_value(asset, exchange)[source]#

Get the USD value of an asset, based on the exchange.

Parameters:

  • asset (str) – The ticker of the asset, i.e. ‘BTC’.

  • exchange (str) – The exchange the asset is on, currently only ‘binance’ and ‘kucoin’ are supported.

Returns:

The worth of this asset in USD.

Return type:

float

cogs.loops.earnings_overview module#

class cogs.loops.earnings_overview.Earnings_Overview(bot)[source]#

Bases: Cog

This class is responsible for sending weekly overview of upcoming earnings. You can enable / disable this command in the config, under [“LOOPS”][“EARNINGS_OVERVIEW”].

earnings#

A background task helper that abstracts the loop and reconnection logic for you.

The main interface to create this is through loop().

earnings_embed(df, date)[source]#
Return type:

tuple[str, Embed]

cogs.loops.events module#

class cogs.loops.events.Events(bot)[source]#

Bases: Cog

This class is responsible for sending weekly overview of upcoming events. You can enable / disable this command in the config, under [“LOOPS”][“EVENTS”].

async get_events()[source]#

Gets the economic calendar from Investing.com for the next week. The data contains the most important information for the USA and EU.

Forked from: alvarobartt/investpy

post_events#

A background task helper that abstracts the loop and reconnection logic for you.

The main interface to create this is through loop().

cogs.loops.funding module#

class cogs.loops.funding.Funding(bot)[source]#

Bases: Cog

This class is used to handle the funding loop. This can be enabled / disabled in the config, under [“LOOPS”][“FUNDING”].

funding#

A background task helper that abstracts the loop and reconnection logic for you.

The main interface to create this is through loop().

async send_embed(df, type)[source]#

Creates an embed based on the given DataFrame and type. Then sends this embed in the designated channel.

Parameters:

  • df (pd.DataFrame) – The dataframe with the ideas.

  • type (str) – The type of ideas, either “stocks” or “crypto”.

Return type:

None

stock_ideas#

A background task helper that abstracts the loop and reconnection logic for you.

The main interface to create this is through loop().

async cogs.loops.ideas.scraper(type)[source]#

Extract the front page of trading ideas on TradingView. Written by: mnwato/tradingview-scraper.

Parameters:

type (string) – Specify the type of trading ideas to scrape, either “stocks” or “crypto”.

Returns:

A dataframe with the ideas of the specified symbol.

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

async get_feargread()[source]#

Gets the last 2 Fear and Greed indices from the API.

Return type:

Optional[tuple[int, str]]

Returns:

  • int – Today’s Fear and Greed index.

  • str – The percentual change compared to yesterday’s Fear and Greed index.

async make_overview(category, tickers, last_sentiment)[source]#
async overview(category, tickers, sentiment)[source]#
async cogs.loops.overview.count_tweets(ticker)[source]#

Counts the number of tweets for a ticker during the last 24 hours. https://developer.twitter.com/en/docs/twitter-api/tweets/counts/api-reference/get-tweets-counts-recent Max 300 requests per 15 minutes, so 20 requests per minute.

Parameters:

ticker (str) – The ticker to count the tweets for.

Returns:

Returns the number of tweets for the ticker.

Return type:

int

cogs.loops.stocktwits module#

class cogs.loops.stocktwits.StockTwits(bot)[source]#

Bases: Cog

This class contains the cog for posting the most discussed StockTwits tickers. It can be enabled / disabled in the config under [“LOOPS”][“STOCKTWITS”].

async get_data(e, keyword)[source]#

Gets the data from StockTwits based on the passed keywords and returns a discord.Embed.

Parameters:

  • e (discord.Embed) – The discord.Embed where the data will be added to.

  • keyword (str) – The specific keyword to get the data for. Options are: ts, m_day, wl_ct_day.

Returns:

The discord.Embed with the data added to it.

Return type:

discord.Embed

stocktwits#

A background task helper that abstracts the loop and reconnection logic for you.

The main interface to create this is through loop().

cogs.loops.timeline module#

class cogs.loops.timeline.Timeline(bot)[source]#

Bases: Cog

The main Class of this project. This class is responsible for streaming tweets from the Twitter API. It can be configured in the config.yaml file under [“LOOPS”][“TIMELINE”].

all_txt_channels#

A background task helper that abstracts the loop and reconnection logic for you.

The main interface to create this is through loop().

get_channel_based_on_category(category, media)[source]#

Get the Discord channel based on the category of the tweet.

Parameters:

  • category (str, optional) – The category of the tweet.

  • media (list) – The images contained in this tweet.

Returns:

The Discord channel.

Return type:

discord.abc.GuildChannel

get_latest_tweet#

A background task helper that abstracts the loop and reconnection logic for you.

The main interface to create this is through loop().

async make_and_send_webhook(channel, tickers, image_e)[source]#

Creates and sends a webhook.

Parameters:

  • channel (discord.abc.GuildChannel) – The Discord channel.

  • tickers (list) – The list of tickers contained in this tweet.

  • image_e (list) – The images contained in this tweet.

Returns:

The Discord message.

Return type:

discord.Message

async on_data(tweet, update_tweet_id=False)[source]#

This method is called whenever data is received from the stream.

Parameters:

  • tweet (dict) – The raw tweet data.

  • update_tweet_id (bool, optional) – Whether or not to update the tweet ID, by default False

Return type:

None

async post_tweet(channel, e, media, tickers, user_channel, category)[source]#

Formats the tweet and passes it to upload_tweet().

Parameters:

  • channel (discord.abc.GuildChannel) – The Discord channel where the tweet should be posted.

  • e (discord.Embed) – The Tweet as a Discord embed object.

  • media (list) – The images contained in this tweet.

  • tickers (list) – The list of tickers contained in this tweet.

  • user_channel (discord.abc.GuildChannel, optional) – The user-specific Discord channel.

  • category (str, optional) – The category of the tweet.

Return type:

None

set_channels(name, charts_channel=None, text_channel=None)[source]#

Set channels for each category.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – The name of the category.

  • charts_channel (str) – The name of the charts channel.

  • text_channel (str) – The name of the text channel.

Return type:

None

async upload_tweet(e, category, media, user_screen_name, tickers)[source]#

Uploads tweet in the dedicated Discord channel.

Parameters:

  • e (discord.Embed) – The Tweet as a Discord embed object.

  • category (str, optional) – The category of the tweet, used to decide which Discord channel it should be uploaded to.

  • media (list) – The images contained in this tweet.

  • user_screen_name (str) – The user that posted this tweet.

  • tickers (list) – The list of tickers contained in this tweet.

Return type:

None

cogs.loops.trades module#

class cogs.loops.trades.Trades(bot, db=                   id      user exchange                                                key                                             secret passphrase 0  240877930589323264  Akkie100  binance  U0QEbij3OhnMKer1buoeWRdDymEkEw1RsEHqYWUy6MzP8t...  i8qUlQrMEQuSyaHSeXDghaSwl95jBpYc0eEifkxGHUAJtr...       None)[source]#

cogs.loops.yield module#

class cogs.loops.yield.Yield(bot)[source]#

Bases: Cog

This class contains the cog for posting the US and EU yield curve. It can be enabled / disabled in the config under [“LOOPS”][“YIELD”].

async get_yield(bonds)[source]#

For each bond in the given list, it gets the yield from TradingView.

Parameters:

bonds (list) – The names of the bonds to get the yield from.

Returns:

The percentages of the yield for each bond.

Return type:

list

make_plot(years, yield_percentage, color, label)[source]#

Makes a matplotlib plot of the yield curve. Each dot is the yield for a specific bond. Connects a spline through the dots to make a smooth curve.

Parameters:

  • years (list) – The years of the yield curve.

  • yield_percentage (list) – The yield percentage for each year.

  • color (str) – The color of the plotted line.

  • label (str) – The label for the plotted line.

Return type:

None

async plot_EU_yield()[source]#

Gets the EU yield curve data from TradingView and plots it.

async plot_US_yield()[source]#

Gets the US yield curve data from TradingView and plots it.

Return type:

None

post_curve#

A background task helper that abstracts the loop and reconnection logic for you.

The main interface to create this is through loop().
